meanings.definition: Not willing to move or change position.
meanings.sent1: The heavy rock was unbudging, refusing to budge an inch.
meanings.sent2: The door was unbudging, stuck firmly in its frame.
meanings.sent3: The unbudging chair wouldn't let anyone move it, causing a funny struggle.
meanings.sent4: Her unbudging determination was like a solid wall, impossible to break through.
meanings.sent5: The unbudging mountain stood tall against the storm, unmoved by the winds.

meanings.definition: Firm or resolute in attitude or opinion.
meanings.sent1: His unbudging belief in honesty never wavered, no matter the situation.
meanings.sent2: She remained unbudging in her decision, despite the arguments against it.
meanings.sent3: The unbudging stance on dessert being the best part of the meal always made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Their unbudging loyalty was a beacon of strength in times of trouble.
meanings.sent5: The unbudging oak tree symbolized his unwavering commitment to his values.
